rainsber@... writes:

> I must concur. I wonder, why the change to "assertTrue" from
> "assert"? The old model seemed more logical: "assert" is the atomic
> action and common assertions are built in terms of "assert", so it
> makes sense that "assert" be the base name and "assertX" be a
> shorthand for "assert(X)".

I think 'assert' is going to be a reserved word in some future version
of Java (if not 1.4), where it will be part of a more c-ish
'assertion' mechanism (i.e. for inline boundry checking and all that,
rather than outside test cases).

JLM
